chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy B Gentry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Timothy B Gentry was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy B Gentry is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Timothy B Gentry was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Timothy B Gentry was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).
  • Timothy B Gentry was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 30 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with sex offender assessment and cooperarate with sex offender treatment.  Must register with the Sex Offender Registry.  No contact with either of the victims or their families (immediate or extended).  No contact with any minors unless approved by supervising agent.  Cooperate with assessments determined appropriate and follow through with recommended treatment, counseling and programs.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED 11-29-2017:  Length of extended supervision sentence corrected to reflect was was ordered by the Court.
